episodeTitle: All-Out Special Power Battle!! Gum-Gum vs. Snake-Snake
episodeTitleJapanese: 能力全開バトル！！ゴムゴムVSヘビヘビ
episodeTitleRomanized: Nōryoku Zenkai Batoru!! Gomu Gomu tai Hebi Hebi
description: Luffy activates Gear 2 and overwhelms the Gorgon Sisters with his enhanced speed. When Sandersonia's clothes catch fire and her back is exposed, Luffy shields her to protect the secret mark, earning the sisters' respect and moving Hancock emotionally.

events.title: Luffy Activates Gear 2
events.description: After struggling against the Gorgon Sisters' Haki abilities, Luffy activates Gear 2 to enhance his speed and power. His body begins steaming as he pumps his blood faster, allowing him to move at speeds that even Sandersonia's Kenbunshoku Haki cannot keep up with.
events.significance: This demonstrates that Gear 2's speed can overcome Observation Haki if the gap is large enough. It shows Luffy adapting his fighting style to counter opponents with superior abilities.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy activates his speed enhancement technique to turn the tide of battle

events.title: Sandersonia's Yamata no Orochi Form
events.description: Boa Sandersonia fully transforms using her Hebi Hebi no Mi, Model: King Cobra powers, manifesting the Yamata no Orochi technique. Her hair transforms into multiple snake heads that attack independently, representing the eight-headed serpent of Japanese mythology.
events.significance: First full display of Sandersonia's Devil Fruit abilities and her most powerful transformation. This technique showcases the Zoan Devil Fruit's ability to manifest mythological characteristics.

events.title: Marigold's Salamander Technique
events.description: Boa Marigold unleashes her Salamander technique, coating herself in flames using her Hebi Hebi no Mi, Model: King Cobra powers. The technique enhances her already formidable physical strength with burning attacks.
events.significance: Reveals Marigold's signature fire-based combat style. This ability will play a crucial role in the climactic moment when it accidentally burns Sandersonia's clothes.

events.title: Luffy Overwhelms the Sisters with Gear 2 Speed
events.description: Using Gear 2, Luffy's speed completely overwhelms both Gorgon Sisters. Despite Sandersonia's Kenbunshoku Haki allowing her to see his movements, she cannot react fast enough to counter or dodge his attacks. Luffy lands multiple clean hits on both sisters.
events.significance: Demonstrates the limitation of Observation Haki - seeing the future is useless if your body cannot move fast enough to react. This is an important lesson about the relationship between Haki and physical abilities.

quotes.text: Even if you can see my attacks coming, it doesn't matter if you can't keep up!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy recognizes the weakness in Sandersonia's Haki defense

events.title: Gomu Gomu no Jet Bazooka
events.description: Luffy uses Gomu Gomu no Jet Bazooka, a Gear 2 enhanced version of his Bazooka attack. He stretches both arms back and launches a devastating double palm strike that sends Marigold flying across the arena.
events.significance: Showcases the power enhancement that Gear 2 provides to Luffy's basic techniques. The Jet series of attacks become signature moves for Luffy throughout the series.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy delivers a powerful Gear 2 enhanced attack

events.title: Gomu Gomu no Jet Gatling
events.description: Luffy unleashes Gomu Gomu no Jet Gatling, rapidly punching in multiple directions simultaneously to counter both sisters' combined attacks. The speed and power of the technique completely nullifies both the Yamata no Orochi and Salamander techniques, sending both sisters crashing into each other.
events.significance: One of Luffy's most powerful Gear 2 techniques, capable of handling multiple opponents simultaneously. This demonstrates Luffy's growth in combat versatility and the effectiveness of multi-directional attacks.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy unleashes a barrage of high-speed punches to counter both sisters at once

events.title: Sandersonia's Clothes Catch Fire
events.description: During the intense battle, Marigold's Salamander fire technique accidentally sets Sandersonia's clothes ablaze. As Sandersonia realizes her back is about to be exposed to the entire arena, panic sets in among the Gorgon Sisters. The crowd watches in anticipation, not understanding the gravity of what is about to be revealed.
events.significance: This accident creates the pivotal moment that will change Hancock's entire perception of Luffy. The potential exposure of the slave mark threatens to reveal the sisters' greatest shame and destroy the carefully constructed lie about the Gorgon's curse.

quotes.speaker: Boa Marigold
quotes.context: Marigold realizes the danger of the situation as Sandersonia's clothes burn

events.title: Luffy Shields Sandersonia's Back
events.description: Instead of taking advantage of his defeated opponent, Luffy immediately leaps onto Sandersonia's back and uses his own body to shield the slave mark (Hoof of the Soaring Dragon) from the view of the arena spectators. He tells Sandersonia not to move and assures her that her back has nothing to do with their fight.
events.significance: This selfless act of compassion is the turning point in Luffy's relationship with the Gorgon Sisters and especially Hancock. Luffy instinctively protects their deepest secret without even knowing what it means, showing his pure character and earning their trust. This moment directly leads to Hancock falling in love with Luffy.

quotes.text: Don't move! Your back has nothing to do with our fight!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy protects Sandersonia's secret from being exposed to the crowd

quotes.speaker: Boa Hancock
quotes.context: Hancock is shocked by Luffy's unexpected compassion

events.title: Hancock Orders Arena Evacuation
events.description: Deeply moved by Luffy's unexpected compassion and recognizing that he is protecting her sisters' secret, Hancock immediately orders all spectators to evacuate the arena. She uses her authority as Empress to clear the area before the slave mark can be seen, using her petrification powers to enforce compliance.
events.significance: This is Hancock's first act showing trust in Luffy. It demonstrates her protective instinct toward her sisters and her quick thinking. The evacuation also sets up the private conversation that will follow in the next episode.

quotes.text: Everyone, leave the arena immediately! This is an order from your Empress!
quotes.speaker: Boa Hancock
quotes.context: Hancock urgently clears the arena to protect her sisters' secret

events.title: The Sisters' Perception of Luffy Changes
events.description: As the arena empties, the three Gorgon Sisters look at Luffy with new eyes. For the first time since their enslavement, a man has shown them pure kindness without any ulterior motive. The sisters realize that Luffy is fundamentally different from any man they have encountered.
events.significance: This marks the beginning of a major shift in the sisters' worldview, particularly Hancock's. Their hatred of men was rooted in their trauma from the Celestial Dragons, but Luffy's selfless act begins to heal that wound. This sets up Hancock's character development and her future role as Luffy's ally.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy activates his speed enhancement to turn the tide of battle

quotes.text: Even if you can see my attacks coming, it doesn't matter if you can't keep up!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy demonstrates the limits of Observation Haki against superior speed

quotes.text: Don't move! Your back has nothing to do with our fight!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy protects Sandersonia's secret mark from the crowd

quotes.speaker: Boa Hancock
quotes.context: Hancock is shocked by Luffy's compassion toward her sister

quotes.text: Everyone, leave the arena immediately! This is an order from your Empress!
quotes.speaker: Boa Hancock
quotes.context: Hancock evacuates the arena to protect the sisters' secret

themes.description: Luffy prioritizes protecting Sandersonia's dignity over winning the fight, demonstrating that true strength includes knowing when not to fight.
themes.symbolism: Luffy's act of shielding Sandersonia's back symbolizes his willingness to protect others' vulnerabilities even at personal cost.

themes.description: The Gorgon Sisters' perception of men begins to change through Luffy's unexpected compassion, showing how genuine kindness can begin to heal deep emotional wounds.
themes.symbolism: The fire that threatens to expose their shame becomes the catalyst for Luffy to demonstrate his character, turning a moment of vulnerability into one of connection.

themes.description: The episode demonstrates that Observation Haki has limitations - foresight is meaningless if one's body cannot react fast enough to what is foreseen.
themes.symbolism: Sandersonia's inability to counter Gear 2 despite seeing it coming represents the gap between knowledge and ability.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy shows his fundamental goodness by protecting Sandersonia's secret despite being in the middle of a battle. His instinctive compassion without understanding the full context demonstrates his pure character.
keyActions: Activates Gear 2 to match the sisters' abilities
Unleashes Jet Bazooka and Jet Gatling techniques
Shields Sandersonia's back from public view
Prioritizes her dignity over his victory
quotes: Don't move! Your back has nothing to do with our fight!

characterSpotlights.development: Hancock witnesses Luffy's selfless protection of her sister and begins to see him as fundamentally different from other men. This marks the beginning of her emotional transformation and eventual love for Luffy.
keyActions: Orders immediate evacuation of the arena
quotes: Everyone, leave the arena immediately! This is an order from your Empress!

characterSpotlights.development: Sandersonia experiences vulnerability when her secret is about to be exposed, then is shocked when her enemy protects her. This begins to change her perception of Luffy and men in general.
keyActions: Clothes catch fire, threatening to expose her back

characterSpotlights.development: Marigold fights alongside her sister and inadvertently creates the crisis when her fire technique burns Sandersonia's clothes. She shares in the relief and gratitude when Luffy protects their secret.
keyActions: Accidentally sets Sandersonia's clothes on fire
Worries about the secret being exposed

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended the Gear 2 combat sequences with additional animation of Luffy's attacks and the sisters' defensive techniques that were shown more briefly in the manga.
Additional reaction shots from the Kuja warriors in the audience watching the battle were added in the anime to build tension and showcase the spectacle of the fight.

trivia.fact: This episode adapts Chapter 520, titled 'Eye of the Gorgon,' which directly references Greek mythology's Medusa and her sisters.
The moment when Luffy protects Sandersonia's back is considered one of the most character-defining moments for Luffy, demonstrating his pure-hearted nature and earning Hancock's love.

sources.title: One Piece: Luffy & Boa Hancock's Relationship, Explained - Game Rant

trivia.fact: This episode demonstrates an important limitation of Observation Haki (Kenbunshoku Haki) - that seeing an attack coming is useless if your body cannot react fast enough to avoid it.

The Jet Gatling technique used in this episode becomes one of Luffy's signature finishing moves throughout the series, later evolving into stronger variants like Elephant Gatling and King Kong Gatling.
Episode 414 aired during a period when One Piece episodes did not have ending themes (from episode 279 to episode 1070), instead featuring extended opening sequences.

sources.title: Why did the anime stop having ending songs since episode 279? - Anime Stack Exchange
